items.title: Editorial Manager, NHL Team Brands
items.content:
Editorial Manager, NHL Team Brands

Writing
Anywhere in US
Company: Vox Media
Full Time

Overview

Vox Media employees thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of brands includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Develop and lead editorial content strategy for assigned team brands centered around seasonal tentpole events.
  • Consults with platform stakeholders (i.e. video, podcasts, etc.), marketing, commerce, legal, and other internal teams as needed to implement NHL content strategy on team brands and SB Nation flagship
  • Oversee assigned team and macro sites and associated budgets, with seasonal adjustments between tentpoles for NHL
  • Develop policies and best practices for assigned team brands for NHL coverage on SB Nation flagship, on NHL team brands, and the efficient integration of the two
  • Conduct editorial oversight, quality control, and accountability for assigned team brand sites in NHL. In some cases, this will included close editorial oversight of original reporting and coverage of sensitive subjects.
  • Work with assigned NHL team brands to continually diversify their contributors and audiences
  • Manage and audit social media, video, podcast and commerce strategies and tactics for assigned NHL team brands and integrate them with SB Nation flagship social strategies
  • Conduct outreach to assigned team brand managers and staffs, and facilitate exchange of story ideas, direction, strategy, tactics, successes, opportunities, knowledge sharing, etc.
  • Serve as primary point of contact for communications to assigned team brands from Vox Media, which may include working with or communicating messages from: product, support, editorial, video, legal, and/or people & culture teams, in conjunction with centralized SB Nation leads
  • Execute on sales strategies in partnership with stakeholders
  • Hire and supervise full-time employee site/team brand producer(s)
  • Serve as primary point of contact for assigned NHL team brands contributors to SB Nation, and provide consistent and reliable support to contributors.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with senior team brand management and producers on NHL coverage.

    • About working at Vox Media: This is a permanent, full-time position with excellent benefits—including flexible hours and generous parental leave. Vox Media strives to provide comprehensive healthcare options for our employees and to ensure that our healthcare and other benefits are LGBTQ-inclusive. You’ll be joining a group of focused, hard-working, creative people who are passionate about doing work that’s challenging and fun—and who strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance.

    Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

    To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/voxmedia/jobs/1230910 →

items.content:
Product Designer

Designer
Anywhere
Company: InVision
Full Time

Overview

InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate  every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at and .

 InVisionApp.comInVisionApp.com/blog

About the team

The Internal Tools Team crafts superb products that empower InVision employees to manage the millions of customers and their variety of questions or issues. We are a multi-disciplinary group with a mission to make finding, understanding and acting on customer information quickly and effortlessly (dare I say enjoyable!). We are driven by research, feedback and iterative design methods to expose, connect, and actualize the right solutions for our customers.

If you have a passion for product design and an aptitude to work in a collaborative environment, can demonstrate empathy and strong advocacy for our users, while balancing the vision and constraints of engineering, then this might be the role for you!

What You’ll Bring:
  • A minimum of 3 years industry experience in product design
  • A strong portfolio with case studies demonstrating creative problem-solving with a proven track record of success
  • Experience working within a cross-functional team in an agile environment
  • Deep understanding of customer problems to create elegant but practical solutions
  • Ability to define problems & goals, map user flows, prototype interactions, and oversee the implementation by partnering closely with engineering
  • Initiative to identify problems and act on opportunities to improve the product offering
  • Strong written & verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to manage and work on multiple projects concurrently

    • What You’ll Get:
    • Shape the next generation of digital design tools
    • Make a real unique impact on the daily work for InVision employees, take on full ownership of the user experience and contribute to our design philosophy
    • Drive innovation, explore novel technologies and elevate the product experience internally and externally
    • Work closely with designers, product managers, engineering and leadership in a highly collaborative environment
    • Learn from a diverse international team. Find mentors and get support for your professional growth
    • Push boundaries and break the product’s status quo to get us to the ideal future state

      • Benefits

      InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have team members throughout 40+ states including New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. The benefits we offer in the United States include competitive health plans and a 401k plan.

      Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country.  Please ask our recruiting team about the benefits and perks package available in your country.

      InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/1230148 →

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: Online Education, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

html
css
javascript
adobe
sketch-3

Job description

Bloc’s mission is to help everyone pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Grading Team Member at Bloc, you will directly help students demonstrate mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers.

Responsibilities

  • Update student roadmap checkpoints to approve or reject submissions
  • Provide detailed feedback of assignment submissions to students, with mentor visibility (within 24 hours)
  • Ensure mentors are aware of student mastery issues and opportunities
  • Integrate mentor guidance for grading emphasis in performing the above
  • Update student profiles with any general notes or information for use by others reviewing student profile
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, student success, or students ad-hoc


Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed Bloc’s Design Track program successfully
  • Strong visual design fundamentals
  • Experience with Figma, Adobe CC, Sketch, Balsamiq, and/or Invision
  • Strong written communication skills
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Excellent taste in design and delightful user experiences
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin

Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest
  • Remote 
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits
Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 300 developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours

items.content:
MLB Video Editor at SBNation

Remote | Freelance

Location: Remote

Description: Vox Media contributors thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of networks includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month. Vox Media’s SB Nation is the fastest-growing online sports media brand and the largest network of more than 300 individual fan-centric sports communities, including SBNation.com, our national flagship property. Our network is powered by the most respected web-native sports journalists. One part of our network is looking for new leadership, and that’s where you come in.

Summary: SB Nation Team Sites are looking for a MLB Video Editor to work on a YouTube channel dedicated to players, moments and events happening with teams across the league. The video editor would be responsible for the following:

  • Producing and editing long-form video content at least once a week specifically for our YouTube channel.
  • Developing and making adjustments to video shows or series to help the YouTube channel grow.
  • Work with the Executive Producer, and specific MLB team sites to create content that will appeal to fans of those teams.
  • Regular communication with SB Nation management regarding site goals, traffic, and progress.

Our best video editor candidates will:

  • Have a passion for baseball news and history.
  • Have strong storytelling skills.
  • Be a self-starter and pitch video ideas regularly.
  • Access to Adobe Creative Suite (specifically After Effects, Premiere, and Photoshop).
  • Compositing and integrating animations and graphics into video.
  • Take responsibility for projects and self-produce/direct when necessary, or alternatively work closely with the Executive Producer to realize a specific vision.

This is a contractor position that pays a monthly stipend. Some daytime availability is preferred. If your background and experience don’t perfectly align with every single thing we’re looking for, but you believe you have the potential to thrive in this role, we encourage you to apply. To apply, please submit a resume, cover letter, and a portfolio/website featuring your work.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds, and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.content:
Concept Artist at Betsoft Gaming

Remote | International

Betsoft Gaming is looking for talented Concept Artists to help bring our visions to life.

We offer the ability to work from home with flexible hours. Our casual working atmosphere allows for creative freedom with an endless flow of steady work.

WORK PLACE: Anywhere, telecommute

Main responsibilities

This job requires strong drawing skills, the ability to work in many styles and the ability to work from direction. A Concept Artist is responsible for creating conceptual sketches of characters and UI/UX design. You will be collaborating with a team of artists and designers to create original content that will be further developed into 3D models. Your drawing skills must be exceptional, with a strong understanding of anatomy and form, perspective, color theory, and composition.

Requirements

You must be proficient in Photoshop, Painter or equivalent drawing and painting tools. You will be required to provide your portfolio or a demonstration video of your past work.

Apply for job

Stealth startup | Ruby (RoR), Android (Kotlin), graphic or UI/UX designer, product, marketing, and growth | Silicon Valley + remote (we're flexible) | Full-time only | Competitive salaries depending on role, experience, and location (ranging $50k - $160k)

We are a stealth company, with millions in seed funding, founded by serial entrepreneurs looking to crack open the unyielding world of real estate and homeownership. This unique industry is riddled with extreme fragmentation and is plagued by a sea of uninspired product offerings. We're a team of seasoned operators and developers that loves to move fast and laughs in the face of nasty-hairy challenges that lie in our path. Home base for us is in the Silicon Valley but we have a team that spans eight countries. So whether you're in bay area, thinking of moving to SV, or are happy where you're at, we'd love to hear from you.

The most important thing we're looking for is a hunger to change the world. If you're an audacious soul looking to tackle one of the biggest problems that plagues our society today and yearning to join an experienced team at the ground floor, then hit us up!

A few years of experience is preferred. Please email your resume and (optional) references/code samples to us at jobs <at> zilly.email

items.title: Senior Graphic Designer
items.content:
Senior Graphic Designer

Designer
Anywhere in US
Company: GitHub
Full Time

Overview

GitHub powers the developer community. Since 2008, our platform has brought people together to collaborate, share ideas, and solve problems to build the future. We’ve enabled over 28 million developers and thousands of businesses to build and share their software projects with people all over the world. From NASA using GitHub to put a rover on Mars to Mailchimp working to improve email, amazing things happen every day on our platform.

In the midst of all this technological collaboration is a vibrant company culture, and art is at the core of it. It not only provides a fun work environment for our fellow Hubbers, but also delights our audience—our superfans. With your help we’ll continue building our team into an artistic powerhouse.

Growing our Design team

We’re growing our Design team at GitHub to creatively solve some of GitHub’s largest business challenges. We support the entire customer journey through a combination of data, instinct, and craft to increase brand awareness and affinity for superfans inside and out of GitHub. We believe the best design has a positive impact on a person’s life, so we put an empathetic understanding at the heart of everything we do.

We’re looking for curious, talented communication/visual designers interested in building the GitHub brand with exceptional online and offline campaign experiences. We’re seeking conceptual thinkers with exceptional design skills to bring the biggest ideas to life while staying flexible in managing the day-to-day design workload. You’ll work closely with your fellow designers and artists to collaborate with teams across all of GitHub to create integrated, effective projects.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in translating marketing objectives into clear creative strategies and enable them to tell inspiring stories that drive measurable impact.
  • Understand and appreciate strategy, defining brand characteristics, and help in establishing and documenting a vision for an entire company.
  • Distill the essence of our company’s personality into visual communications that connect with customers.
  • Obsess about typography, imagery, the interplay between words and pictures, and how all of this tells a story appropriate to the brand.
  • Develop product and service communications such as printed collateral, packaging, email notifications, and signage.
  • Collaborate with product designers, web designers, and engineers to ensure the coherence of our end-to-end brand experience.
  • Drive cross-functional meetings
  • Contribute strategically and in the execution of our work, while educating internal teams on the importance of brand strategy to ensure consistency across all platforms.
  • Lead creative solutions across the customer journey, from brand awareness to purchase decision

    • Minimum Qualifications:
    • Minimum of 5–10 years experience; contributing to multiple omni-channel projects that ladder up to a larger creative strategy and business context
    • Doer and leader, with a desire to understand the business context of your work
    • Experience in developing the process/approach for tackling problems
    • Strong facilitation and listening skills
    • Possess strong empathy and compassion
    • Online portfolio demonstrating strong conceptual thinking and a variety of projects, as well as an understanding of design principles
    • Familiar with technology-driven creative environments

      • Who We Are:

      GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over fifteen million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com and GitHub Business, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.

      What We Value:

       We believe the best work is done together.  We believe in putting people first.  We believe in setting the standard for excellence.  We believe in making the world a better place through our work.  We believe in creating things for the people using them.

      Collaboration:
      Empathy:
      Quality:
      Positive Impact:
      Shipping:

      Why You Should Join:

      At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We’ve designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where over half of our Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The other half of our Hubbers work remotely in 18 countries across the globe.

      We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We’ve designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we’ve built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

      GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there’s any way we can make the interview process better for you; we’re happy to accommodate!

      *Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask your Recruiter!

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/github/jobs/1227385 →

items.content:
Hello All,

One of our client is looking for the following resource

Position: Design Verification Engineer (Remote Job)

Location: Boxborough, MA

Duration: 12 Months on W2 basis

Pay Rate: $85/hr on W2 - With No Benefits

Job Description :

Position can sit remotely anywhere in the U.S. Will need to travel to Markham, ON for a full week during the first few weeks of the assignment.

Description:

RESPONSIBILITIES :

• Work with global Front-End design team for large scale ASIC microprocessor and related
functions.
• Focus on digital design verification in simulation and hardware prototype platforms.
• Responsible for multiple aspects in design verification planning and execution.
• Accountable for project delivery.
• Reading Design Specifications and Converting the specs to Verification tests and plan

REQUIREMENTS :

• Familiar with Unix/Linux environment and good at scripts
• Understand the architecture of the chip and functional block being designed
• Build UVM, Verilog and/or C/C++ model for simulation
• Build testbenches, UVM UVCs for DUT with checkers and scoreboards.
• Compose test plan following design specs and validation vectors to ensure functional
completeness.
• Excellent knowledge with AMBA interfaces (i.e AXI, AHB)

Preferred Experience:

o Familiar with Linux Environment (including shell scripting, perl and linux gnu tools)

o Experience with design for verification (functional coverage, test plan)

o Should be versatile in any one of the high level verification flow such as SV, UVM / OVM etc as well as knowledge of industry standard tools for verification

o Should have excellent communication skills (both written and oral) o Strong problem solving skills

Interested candidates can share their resume at OR call me directly on

Thank you

  • provided by Dice Design* AND Verification AND ASIC AND (Unix OR Linux) AND UVM AND Verilog AND ("C" OR "C++")

items.content:
Designer

Anywhere in the US
Company: Mossio

FULL-TIME

Overview

DESCRIPTION

We’re on the hunt for a new designer to join our growing team. We have some really exciting new things happening to our company in the coming months, and have been working on really awesome projects with some clients. We have an immediate need for a designer that will help lead and manage projects from the ideation phase, all the way up to completion. So if you eat, sleep and breathe design, come join our team!

We are a high quality pixel shop, so we want to work with like minded and high quality pixel perfectionists. We are selecting candidates based on strength of work in website design, user interface for web and mobile applications, and of course branding experience is a plus! We’re looking for awesome communicators, team players and overall cool people to join our team. We have a pretty relaxed atmosphere and we like it that way.

We work on exciting products for web and mobile applications, and building some really cool websites with really awesome clients. So you will be helping design for large scale web applications and a various amount of small to large scale mobile applications.

We want to hear from you if you consider yourself an amazing designer with a passion for creativity. If web design and user interface is what you dream about. Last but not least, if you like the human race. We love people, and more importantly love working with lovely people.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3-5+ years of design experience with 2+ years focused on web
  • Mobile/Desktop UI/UX design experience
  • Expert at Sketch (If you know PS, you’ll love and pickup Sketch fast), Photoshop and/or Illustrator
  • Experience working with developers to understand how your design translates into working code and it’s capabilities (and potentially limitations)
  • Expert knowledge in strategy, identity, and branding as they relate to design
  • Working knowledge of wireframes, mockups and simple, logical design
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, networking, presentation and negotiation skills
  • Ability to design within an existing visual style
  • Ability to justify and defend your design recommendations
  • Ability to collaborate with the team to push boundaries, and create the best end product together
  • Demonstrated track record of success in a fast-paced, team work oriented environment
  • Ability to laugh.

Nice to Have (but not required)

  • Strong knowledge of Android User Interface Guidelines, iOS Human Guidelines and other web & mobile standards
  • Basic understanding of HTML & CSS
  • Knowledge of languages like JavaScript and Ruby
  • Knowledge of Haml and Sass preferred
  • Experience with Git

BENEFITS

  • Excellent Benefits including Health Insurance, Dental and Vision
  • Unlimited Vacation Policy
  • Personal Development Days. We work on a 4 day work week, reserving Friday’s for our team’s growth, learning, and self improvement.
  • Conference Allowance. We love learning and see the value in attending design conferences to stay inspired and spend time together as a team.
  • Flex scheduling to make things easier.
  • Fully remote position
  • We get to work on fun, engaging, and cutting edge projects
  • Join an amazing team that has strong passion for design

How to Apply

Let us know why you feel you are not just a qualified candidate, but a stand out candidate for this position. Yes, work can speak for itself, but we also hire for personality and culture. We want to learn a little more about you behind those pixels.

Check Us Out

See more of us over at:

Social /mossiodotco

Apply for job

UX Designer - Pharmaceutical - English - Barcelona - Remote - Spain

NextLink is having an existing position as an UX Designer for global projects in Barcelona area, Spain.

General information:

Start date: ASAP

End date: 6 months

Work load: 100%

Work location: Barcelona area and/or remote

Remote: 100% possible 

Must Haves:

  • Candidate needs to have a base experience on graphic design,2-3 years, from paper, digital or else.
  • We need a creative and visual person base, more than a technical.
  • Industry experience Health care or Pharma and/or creative industries
  • At least 5 years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments.
  • Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
  • Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
  • Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
  • Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
  • A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
  • Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
  • Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.
    Fluent English

For a chance to work in Spain as an UX Designer please call me or send me your CV as soon as possible!

Leila Benabdallah

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere in the USA only at this time)

Please, no recruiters or staffing agencies.

ABOUT THE POSITION

Southleft is seeking a creative problem solver who would love the challenge of building exclusive, fast, lightweight, and user-friendly websites for clients with novel and ambitious requests. Our ideal candidate for this full-time, salaried role would have at least 2 years of experience in web development and a very sharp design sense. You should be able to manage your time well as a remote worker and be self-driven to provide excellent attention to clean coding detail, with the ability to accept feedback and implement positive changes.

Your responsibilities would include creating design concepts, implementing those concepts into code, revising and building upon feedback, and completing browser and QA testing – all on a project by project basis as assigned. We’d love for you to contribute innovative ideas to our team with knowledge and experience you’ve gained along the way. You should eagerly welcome the ebb and flow of web projects, being flexible with scheduling as necessary.

PREFERRED SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS

  • HTML5
  • CSS3 (using a preprocessor such as Sass)
  • Javascript
  • Drupal Theming, WordPress
  • Git
  • Responsible, clear communicator
  • Basic understanding of web standards, accessibility, and responsive web design with a performance-first approach

BONUS POINTS

  • Front-end build tools (such as Webpack, Gulp, Grunt, etc.)
  • Familiarity with an agile project workflow
  • Based in or around the New Orleans metro area

ABOUT US

Southleft is a husband-and-wife-run boutique digital design agency based in New Orleans, LA. We specialize in producing customized websites from scratch for progressive organizations and digital teams. Our clients are varied but many are in the media and lifestyle brand industries who have complex and heavy content for a wide user base. We value respect for and courteousness to clients and other team members, integrity in our work, and a humble confidence in our ability to learn and grow on a daily basis.

Job Perks: - work from home- 401(k)- educational & training opportunities- flexible schedule- computer equipment- high-profile client base- paid time off- room to grow & develop your role- performance bonuses

Apply: All applicants should include a cover letter, a resume, and links to sites that demonstrate your design and coding skills. Please, no recruiters or staffing agencies.

items.content:
User Happiness Representative at Chatfuel

Remote | Entry-level | International
  • San Francisco, CA – Remote OK
  • Full-Time

Chatfuel is looking for a dynamic and driven individual to join our awesome User Happiness/Customer Support team.

We are the largest platform for building bots on Facebook Messenger. Bots are pieces of software that help automate communication with humans through messaging applications. Since messengers have become the most heavily used mobile apps, bots have emerged as effective instruments that are changing the world of digital marketing. Our customers use bots for sales and marketing funnel automation, lead generation and nurturing, customer support and communication.

Chatfuel’s bot creators are influencers, celebrities, global consumer brands, large and small businesses, etc. Some of our largest customers include Audi, Mercedes Benz, T-Mobile, MTV, TechCrunch, Reebok, Golden State Warriors, Katy Perry, and many others.

As a User Happiness Representative, you will get a chance to help our awesome users on a daily basis. Questions can range from small technical challenges to hypothetical partnership inquiries and so forth.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily monitoring of our Intercom CRM and handling of new incoming requests
  • Handling of bug reports collecting details, reproducing, reporting to engineering team
  • Monitoring our Community Message Boards and responding to inquiries
  • Scanning social media groups for inquiries about Chatfuel and responding as needed
  • Communicating with Chatfuel’s community moderators and addressing their questions

Expectations:

  • Minimum 1 to 2 years experience in a Tech Support role at a SaaS company with a b2b product.
  • Positive attitude enthusiastic about helping people
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Good understanding of software and technical aptitude
  • Tech- or math-focused education is a plus, but not a requirement
  • Outstanding communication skills, active, quick, well-organized, responsible
  • Comfortable with remote work.

Location

The User Happiness Representative position is a remote position. We are focused on hiring people located in Europe, or the Australia/Asia time zones, but open to accepting applications from people located throughout the world.

Why Us?

What makes Chatfuel a great place to work? Here are just a few reasons why you should apply to join us:

  • A strong team: we’ll help you improve your skills, grow, and evolve
  • Freedom to create and act: tell us what you’d like to do and do it!
  • Mind-blowing growth: our user base doubles several times a year, and we grow along with it.
  • A great product: our platform helps people and businesses create bots that deliver a meaningful value.
  • Build your own brand: participate in the growing bot community, help people, and establish yourself as an expert in your field.
Apply for job

items.content:
We are looking for a high-performance team player—Is this You?

This position is a unique opportunity to gain varied experience of working at a fast-growing online startup, alongside a passionate, dynamic and welcoming team. It’s a chance to put your passion and knowledge of video production and video storytelling into practice whilst supporting our journey that truly seeks to create change. We are looking to find a resourceful and enthusiastic expert that is both a video editor and a video storyteller and is able to create impact through the creative application of storytelling, beauty and fun while valuing frugality, simplicity and precision. This person needs to be savvy in writing, filming, lighting, interviewing, editing and be able to versioning for our various social media and website channels.

We are looking for a high-performance team player—Is this You?

- 3+ years of experience with creating various videos like: brand videos, promotional videos, explainer videos, company culture, animation videos, educational videos and testimonial videos.
- Distil themes and determine video content priorities.
- Research, write, film and edit video content while adhering to brand guidelines.
- Design and build motion graphics.
- Familiarity with basic design concepts including colour theory and typography.
- Skills and experience in impacting behaviour and creating emotional connections including storytelling.
- Familiarity with digital marketing trends.
- Knowledge of User Experience.
- Experience with video compression for online distribution.
- Demonstrated ability to stage, light productions, operate video cameras and sound recording equipment.
- Good understanding of video production equipment, video artistic styles, techniques, methodologies, and effects.
- Able to manage multiple projects with minimal supervision.
- Possess the ability to present ideas and concepts.
- Attention to detail.
- Sense of fun, beauty and simplicity.
- Has a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with technology and internet businesses.
- Has worked in remote online teams for at least 5 years.
- Hands-on practical experience with collaborative digital tools, such as Asana, - Basecamp, Facebook Workplace, Google Calendar, Google Docs, Google Forms, Google Drive, Google Sheets, Google Slides, Microsoft Office 365, RealTimeBoard, Skype, Slack, Trello, and Typeform.
- Excellent English both verbal and written.
- Willing to work for future equity while we are in startup mode.

We would love if you have the following too
- Experience in the working field of startups, scaleups and corporates.

How to Apply
Have a look at our website on the open positions page.

Why Join us?
A unique opportunity to earn equity and be part of an early stage startup.
Enjoy a very flexible working environment: online, remote, working up to 80% of the time that you prefer, no travel required.
Exclusive opportunity for mentorship to guide your ambitions.

Our Offer
Part-time online position, with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week for the duration of 1 year.
Not exclusive, hence you can continue to work at the existing place of employment.
Your Reward will be based on equity and there will be no salary as we are in currently startup mode.

Who are we?
We are a purposeful, passionate, international, multi-generational team based in Berlin, London, and Zurich.
We are pioneering new ways of working and disrupting the leadership space.

items.content:
Graphic Designer at Townsquare Media

Remote

Remote

Townsquare Media

Graphic Designer

*Remote Opportunities Available
Please include portfolio to be considered

Seeking a Graphic Designer to join our Creative Services team. Our designers create digital ads for clients across the country and will be displayed on both our sites and across digital ad exchanges. You will help these clients establish a digital presence in their respective markets through engaging ad designs. This high volume position reports to the Project Manager of Creative Services and Senior Director of Local Digital and works with the local market sales teams to meet the digital needs of their clients. We seek a self-starter designer with a very keen sense of detail, ability to work with very short deadlines, and good advertising design aesthetic.

Summary of Responsibilities

Produces digital banners in various sizes (from site skins to banner ads) and within ad specifications for clients who want to advertise online but don’t have the resources to make their own ads. Attention to detail, consistency and ability to quickly produce quality work will be the key to success. This position works under the immediate supervision of the Creative Services Project Manager.

Background Knowledge

  • Typography
  • Advertisement/Copy Hierarchy
  • Color Theory
  • Advanced Photoshop
  • Advanced Illustrator
  • HTML5 ad building

Job Responsibilities

  • Complete assigned design queue each day in addition to working with Creative Services Manager to complete any additional projects (minimum of 10 new tickets per day)
  • Work with rest of design team to accomplish team goals
  • Work with Creative Services Project Manager to meet deadlines
  • Design beautiful ads within a tight timeframe
  • Take direction from sales and clients and have their vision come to life

Requirements

  • Unparalleled attention to detail
  • Impeccable sensitivity and knowledge to color theory, typography, hierarchy and balance
  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience as a production or graphic designer with focus on digital
  • An impressive online portfolio is mandatory
  • Ability to produce high volumes of quality work under tight deadlines
  • Expert Photoshop and Illustrator skills
  • HTML5 experience a big plus

About Us

Townsquare Media Group is a diversified media, entertainment and digital marketing services company that owns and operates radio, digital and live event properties. The Company specializes in creating and distributing original entertainment, music and lifestyle content. Its assets include 318 radio stations and over 325 local companion websites in 65+ small to mid-sized markets, a national portfolio of music and entertainment digital properties reaching over 50 million US unique visitors monthly, including Taste of Country, XXL Mag, Diffuser.fm, Ultimate Classic Rock, Loudwire, TheFW, GuySpeed, ScreenCrush and PopCrush, approximately 550 live music and non-music events annually, and Seize the Deal, an E-commerce business. Additionally, Townsquare also operates Townsquare Cares, a non-profit organization that seeks to better the lives of troops and their families.

TOWNSQUARE MEDIA BROADCASTING, LLC MAINTAINS A DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE AND IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. APPLICANTS MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE U.S.

Townsquare Media provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Townsquare Media complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Townsquare Media expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Townsquare Media’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Job Description

ASAP need for for a UI/UX Designer who can produce a highly intuitive design, branding and an interactive prototype for an exciting new project.

UI/UX Designer responsibilities include basing design requirements to a parallel and defined set of epics, stories and criteria, designing graphic elements, building navigation components, and to help create a unique and intuitive web app/ site. Our candidate would have proven experience with design software, wireframe and interactive prototyping tools. We strongly prefer a candidate who is versed and experienced with Ionic. Please have a portfolio of professional design projects that include work with web/mobile applications.

Responsibilities

  • Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with stakeholders
  • Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
  • Designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
  • Build page navigation including buttons and search fields
  • Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
  • Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
  • Prepare and present rough drafts to stakeholders
  • Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
  • Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer
  • Experience producing wireframes, interaction models, branding elements
  • Experience taking requirements and producing an intuitive, modern design
  • Experience with tools like Sketch and Azure or equivalent
  • Good time-management skills
  • Experience with IONIC (optional but preferred)

Job is based on Orlando Florida, but work can be remote.

Company DescriptionA boutique consulting company, working with clients and creating innovative projects.

items.title: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer

  • Designer
  • Anywhere in US
  • Posted June 26
  • SeatGeek
    • Full Time

    Overview

    We believe design can be the competitive advantage for a company. We’ve set out to build the future of live events, and we want that future to be beautiful and elegantly simple.

    Design is currently the biggest bottleneck on our team. In addition to our core event discovery and ticket buying experience we’re now working closely with some of the biggest names in sports to enhance the season ticket holder and day of event experience. We are more excited than ever about the opportunities ahead, and are looking for passionate designers to help us push forward these initiatives.

    What You’ll Do
    • Shape the direction of upcoming projects by exploring concepts and creating prototypes
    • Craft simple and elegant solutions for ongoing projects
    • Contribute towards our style guide to ensure a consistent look and feel across our apps
    • Collaborate with product managers and developers to bring new ideas to life

      • Who You Are
      • You have a portfolio of delightfully simple and easy to use mobile and/or web apps
      • You’ve mastered Sketch, or at least have experience with Photoshop/Illustrator/XD/Figma and are interested in learning how to use Sketch

      • You have pixel-perfect attention to detail
      • You want to work in a scrappy environment (i.e. a startup). You like working independently.
      • You care a great deal, on a personal level, about what you design.
      • You have experience and/or interest in working as part of a remote team

items.content:
Web Designer

Headquarters: Carlsbad, CA
URL: https://jamiak.workable.com/

DESCRIPTION

Jamiak LLC. is looking for a talented, experienced Web Designer with a visionary eye for creating beautiful modern user experiences. (REMOTE friendly role)

YOU WILL

This candidate will be responsible for overseeing and leading all creative initiatives from concept to delivery. You will work with account managers and project managers to provide expertise on UI/UX design, and information architecture and connect the dots between business needs, innovation and good design.

Driven by impact and Data: We are passionate about creating our direct to consumer brands that deliver a better experience and are always asking, “How can we improve our customer’s experience?” and then use testing (User and A/B) to reveal the effectiveness of any given update or project.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working in the digital sector designing websites
  • Experience with Zeplin or other collaboration tools
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS and basic JavaScript to understand the fundamentals of website development
  • Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio
  • Experience working with teams and maintaining all aspects of a brand style guide (logo, color pallete, typography, imagery, brand story, voice)
  • Expert with Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe XD)
  • Excellent understanding of designing responsive websites
  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to the development team
  • Experience of managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience working remotely
  • Strong communication skills to relay design vision to peers and executive level stakeholders
  • Ability to help out on other marketing collateral projects when needed such as slide decks, brochures, one-pagers, business cards, etc.

BENEFITS

  • Medical
  • Vision
  • Dental
  • Competitive Salary

To apply: Complete online application https://jamiak.workable.com/j/CE00194B73

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Short Term

EXPERIENCE: expert

SKILLS:
• UX/UI Design
• Web Design
• Usability

Are you a UI Design Ninja looking for an opportunity to create visually stunning interface designs for web, mobile, and applications from your home office? Do you think imaginatively to produce new ideas and concepts? Would you like to work with a company recently featured in CIOReview Magazine as one of the 20 Most Promising Customer Experience Management Solutions Providers?

If so, you're in luck because this fast-growing tech company is looking for a talented, experienced UI Designer to produce graphical assets to meet our client’s unique needs. Satori Interactive is a rapidly-expanding UI/UX interactive design firm based in Alpharetta, GA. We hold ourselves to high standards of excellence, we value everybody’s opinion, and we share accountability to each other, the success of the company and the clients we serve.

In this role you will conceptualize and design graphic applications such as collateral material, environmental graphics, digital media, books and magazines, corporate identity, film titling and multimedia interfaces. You will work on 2 – 3 client engagements simultaneously in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving agency environment. You will collaborate as an integral part of a team with printers, copywriters, photographers, stylists, illustrators, other designers, account executives, information architects, web developers and marketing specialists on multiple projects from concept to completion.

items.content:
Job description
We are looking for a passionate Lead Games Artist to design and lead the development of our game platform. If you love to stay on top of cutting-edge technologies and want to create a revolutionary product with us. If you seek an opportunity to make a direct impact in the industry, shine within the company and with outside stakeholders. There is no limit to your role, except your own ambition.
You will be a valued member of the core team and take part in all high-level decision making. You will be responsible for the games tech side and in charge of making it happen. You will follow your passion, be present in the struggle and own a part of the success.
We value attitude, mentality and cultural fit over experience; however previous experience in a startup is a big plus.
Some people need to be told exactly what to do, and when. If you are not one of these people and you have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset, you are a risk taker who wants to shape the growth of a disruptive business in gaming, then we have got the perfect opportunity for you!
Our offices are located in London and Athens. Mainly you will work remotely, however face to face meetings are required following business needs.
We also strive for that great balance of being a team that feels like a family. That means we share feedback regularly, support each other's self-improvement efforts and personal plans, and see honest mistakes as opportunities to learn together.

Skills
A degree or HND in an art subject, such as fine art, graphic design or illustration. 2D, art tools, especially PhotoShop. Would be nice: 3D art tools, especially Maya.
Benefits
Flexible working hours. Work the hours that make you more happy and productive, keeping in mind time-zones and work deliverables. Simultaneously learn and contribute, while working with big studios and indie developers. You will get the opportunity to work with the best, take on a lot of responsibility and grow.
Compensation
Stock Options program. Joining the Conclify core team, means you are entrusted to own part of the company.

Job Responsibilities

In charge of all visual aspects, branding and the look and feel of both Conclify and our games.
In charge of the production or selection of mockups and any visual or game assets.
You will hold the leading role in the game production process.
You will be brain storming and developing ideas, for new features and content.
You will contribute to the creation of new concepts and pitches.
Make tough decisions while being aware of the impact on the business.
Develop and manage Conclify's game developers' network.

Required Skills

Have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset.
Very high levels of enthusiasm, energy and passion for games, games development and a good understanding of what makes a game visually appealing and fun to play.
Be proactive, self-motivated and able to inspire and motivate a team of creative talents.
Can-do attitude with speed and product in mind.
Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks.
Strong interpersonal and written communications ability and skills.
Business mindset. Decision making. Problem solving.
Have a team-oriented attitude and analytical mind.
Have a distinctive and original style.
Demonstrate a desire to learn and grow professionally.
Be able to take criticism and feedback on your ideas, take a step back and then iterate, but at the same time have confidence in your ideas, i.e. a balance of humbleness to accept feedback of others with confidence in your thinking.
Experience working in agile and rapid prototyping.
Extensive knowledge of (mobile) games.
Strong attention to detail (UI, animation, sound effects, etc.)
Would be nice: Knowledge of the Unity, Unreal game engines & HTML5.
Would be nice: Creative in new game concepts.
Would be nice: Understanding of free-to-play gaming and best practices in this domain.
Have an online art portfolio. (include the URL in your submission)

items.title: YouCanBook.me: User Interface Designer (UK)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
User Interface Designer (UK)

Posted Jun 19

YouCanBook.me
Headquarters: Bedford, UK
https://youcanbook.me/jobs/
View all YouCanBook.me jobs →

We're hiring a UI designer to play a major role in driving forward our design initiative, creating a memorable experience for our users with beautiful, intuitive and well thought out interfaces. 

Core responsibility

~ design beautiful and intuitive interfaces for our product ~

Core tasks

  • Responsible for designing all UI elements and assets for the product development pipeline across mobile, tablet and desktop.
  • Own the visual identity of the YouCanBook.me brand across our marketing sites and web applications
  • Create, improve and standardise our design systems, principles and assets.
  • Work with the Head of UX to research and understand customer usage to help define requirements for new product features and releases.

Skills / Experience we would expect to see:

  • Mid to senior UI designer, with probably 3 years or more designing web applications
  • Hands-on experience creating storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes and pixel perfect mockups and designs
  • A user centred design process with a focus on understanding users to inform design decisions.
  • Knowledge and opinions about systems and how best to do things - we’re looking for a balance of ‘been there before’ and ‘oooh, would like to get stuck in and learn how to do that’
  • A passion for design theory such as grid systems, colour, typography and iconography
  • A strong portfolio, focussed on web application design, to demonstrate your work and design thinking.

Stop wondering what it would be like to work for an amazing company.
Apply to come and work for one.*

We are YouCanBook.me - one of the fastest growing scheduling tools in the world...

. . . our tool is big (hundreds of thousands of users and customers)
. . . the number of bookings we’ve done is big (30 million to date)
. . . the love is big (top scheduling app on G2 Crowd)

but as a company, we are super tiny.

We’re 100% remote, 100% bootstrapped, profitable and growing.

We’ve decided it’s time to expand the team.

Don't apply if you're looking to rise up the ranks of a mega-corp. Instead, join our ranks, and build your craft inside our tardis.

We need you.

What we’re about:

You would get to work for a company with some amazing customers - everyone from the single marketeer or university professor, to the some of the biggest companies in the world (customers from Pearson, Box, Yelp, Shopify, Pinterest, Expedia, Atlassian and many, many more all use our tool).

Our company has been named one of the top performing UK tech companies by G2 Crowd. We love sponsoring conferences like SaaStock in London and SDX in Portland in June

Our co-founder and CEO, Bridget Harris, has been named a national finalist in the digital category for the 'Forward Ladies' awards for women in business. She's a regular speaker at conferences like Business of Software and Microconf and this year was speaking at LTV Conf and SaaStock 2018.

Why does that matter? Because we like sharing how we 'walk the talk' on company culture and building a sustainable, happy software business.

We are working to build an amazing place where work gets done. You'd be joining a handful of smart, imaginative, hard workers and learners. We meet up around twice a year from our locations in the US, Spain and the UK. This year we met up in the wonderful Costa Rica. We share and build. We celebrate success together. We work on where we went wrong, and build something better.

We like: systems, processes, automation, documentation, scaling, profit and happy customers.

We don't like: over-working, being stressed, sloppy work, typs, actual offices, paperwork, not being able to help.

You need to join us.

*All our jobs are secure and employed - this position is UK (remote) only

  • private health + dental insurance 
  • 25-30 days PTO (it’s flexible) + public holidays
  • Generous paternity + maternity benefits
  • International travel (our last two company retreats were Portugal and Costa Rica)
  • Profit share after 2 years, long term security in a company that’s solid and growing.
  • Open and transparent company - we share everything from revenue to salaries

Apply for this position

head over to https://youcanbook.me/jobs/ and follow the links to our application forms.

items.title: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer - Jobmote

Product Designer

DockYard

DockYard seeks an exceptional Product Designer with a passion for UX and visual design to join our remote team in creating user-centered web applications!

Product Designer

This is an amazing opportunity to become a member of our exceptional product design team for a premiere, full-stack software consultancy. DockYard works with ambitious clients across a range of verticals, including: Netflix, Flywheel Sports, McGraw-Hill Education, Zipcar, and more.

We have a holistic approach to product design with an amazing team of designers and engineers. We are looking for someone who enjoys the challenge of making the complex simple and has a passion for the intersection of technology and design.

You are a full-stack product designer. Your workflow includes product discovery, design strategy, wireframing, user journey mapping, iterative prototyping, user research, user testing, and visual design. We take a user-centric approach to solving design challenges and are focused on growing our industry-leading expertise in Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) in 2018 and beyond.

What you’ll do:

  • Design clean, intuitive flows and experiences that excite our clients’ users
  • Bring solid research and discovery practices to inform design and UX solutions
  • Wireframe, prototype, and create hi-fidelity designs
  • Craft beautiful and elegant user-centered solutions
  • Partner with our engineers, UXD, PMs and stakeholders to oversee user experience for products and features from conception to launch
  • Work in solidarity with our customers and other DockYard teams
  • Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with engineers and designers
  • Provide and seek feedback from other designers to always push quality
  • Design systems experience a plus

What we’re looking for:

  • 3+ years of product design experience
  • An excellent communicator who can work well with clients and diverse teams
  • Experience designing and shipping products that customers love
  • Experience with the full-range of product, interaction, and visual design
  • Experience using data to inform design and product decisions
  • Talent in creating and maintaining complex design systems
  • Ability to clearly communicate product strategy, design rationale and conceptual ideas
  • Proficiency with Creative Suite, Sketch, and prototyping tools.
  • A portfolio of top-notch product work that demonstrates strong design and UX skills

DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

We are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role.

items.content:
Product Designer

Posted Jun 12

Elastic.co
Headquarters: Mountain View, CA; Amsterdam, The Netherlands
https://www.elastic.co/about/careers
View all Elastic.co jobs →

We have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. Elastic is the leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security and analytics use cases. Since its initial release in 2012, Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations like Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, NY Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. We believe that diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

What You'll be Doing:

In this role, you will spearhead the product design initiatives for Kibana Canvas. We will look to you for expertise related to product designs, prototypes and UX flows for the Kibana / UI team, maintain our Sketch library and keep parity once your designs are coded, provide design recommendations and support through code review for a large team, and supply iconography and illustration work as needed in your design. All while doing so with the full support of a Leadership team who knows the importance of design.

You will be given the freedom and autonomy to create beautiful work in an environment of your choice, working remotely with an international team of world-class Engineers and Designers. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a huge impact on the evolution of Canvas while also being a part of shaping the future of how Product Design works at Elastic, this could be your dream job! This requires, not only a level of creativity and ingenuity but also the hunger and grit to roll your sleeves up and build something extraordinary.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to talk.

What is Kibana Canvas?

Kibana Canvas is a new data presentation, manipulation and communication application on top of Elasticsearch. Canvas is wildly flexible, enticingly extensible and plain fun to use. It’s as beautiful as you make it and we want YOU to help make it more flexible, more beautiful, and more fun. For more information check out our Canvas page on our website http://canvas.elastic.co/

What You've Done:

  • 5+ years of design experience working on complicated web applications or SaaS products.
  • Experience with Sketch, specifically in the context of developing a design system.
  • Facility with thinking in terms of systems, marked by an ability to make design decisions that scale and result in reusable patterns, palettes, and components.
  • Considers how low-level design decisions affect the big picture and the future evolution of the UX.
  • The ability to code your designs in HTML and Sass or a similar preprocessor.
  • A positive attitude and a matching commitment to innovate

Bonus Skills:

  • Familiarity with JS frameworks like React or Angular.
  • Experience building responsive and accessible designs.

Additional Information

  • Deeply competitive pay and Stock options
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with employees all over the world, some even fly south for the winter :)

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply for this position

Please apply through our website via the link here > https://grnh.se/a7f70f341

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About OLIO

At OLIO we're solving a really big problem (food waste) and are doing it in a sophisticated but elegant way (mobile technology combined with the sharing economy). In just over two years, over half a million users have joined us and have together shared 3/4 million portions of food. We're looking for people to join our team who are passionate about the cause, and who want to work in a challenging, but exciting and collaborative environment as we embark upon the next phase of our growth.

JOIN OUR TEAM!

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for a Product Designer. You will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager, with a dotted reporting line into Lloyd Watkin, Lead Developer.

In this role you will be responsible for:

- All aspects of the creative design, UI and UX for the OLIO apps (Android, iOS & web app), and other digital assets (web site, emails, social media content)
- Developing, maintaining & enforcing clear creative guidelines that embody the OLIO brand
- Undertaking user research and reviewing engagement data to ensure a user-centric design process
- Designing storyboards, wireframes and mock-ups of simple, engaging experiences for our users
- Liaising with the development & product stakeholders to get feedback on, and buy-in for, your proposed designs
- Delivering detailed, pixel perfect assets and specs to our developers
- Continuously think about how to improve the user experience across our products
- Proposing ways in which the OLIO product experience can ‘surprise & delight’ our users through creative design
- Keeping up to date with the latest guidelines and trends for mobile design

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

IS THIS YOU?

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

- Experience in designing mobile user interfaces for hybrid/native mobile apps is essential
- Detailed knowledge of material design and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
- Expert knowledge in user experience principles, graphic design and mobile & responsive web standards
- Strong visual design skills evidenced by examples of where you’ve created pixel-perfect consumer products
- Recognise the value of getting an MVP into the market and learning and iterating from there
- Passion for user research and metrics that track product successes
- Expert level in Sketch/Photoshop and Illustrator
- Experience in creating interactive prototypes (ideally Marvel or Invision)
- Experience creating navigation and page layout/templates, functional design, iconography, look and feel and style guides
- An eye for detail

And all OLIO team members share these attributes:

- A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
- Resourceful and creative
- Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
- A ruthless ability to prioritise
- Excellent communication skills
- Fun to work with

items.content:
ABOUT US
Sofar Sounds is bringing the magic back to live music, hosting intimate secret living room gigs over 400 cities world-wide. We are dedicated to supporting artists, transforming the way live music is experienced and discovered, offline and on.

Our inclusive, global community is the heart of Sofar. Reflecting this, our staff are based in NYC and London, with remote team members in South America, Europe and India.

Watch our intro video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qnjsN2NOl3k

ROLE & TEAM
We’re looking for an experienced UX designer to join us who is confident taking product development ideas through a lean, user-centred design process, from idea validation and research, to delivering web and app user journeys and interfaces, working with and improving our brand guidelines and component style-guide.

You’ll be joining our growing digital team, working closely with our tech and product teams, and junior UX researcher. You will be instrumental in product design decisions, across our online and digital experience. Our intimate concerts are truly magical. A key design goal is to reflect this magic and our love of artists online.

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES

Essential:
- Experience in working end-to-end with the product, defining problems and goals, creating user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, giving and soliciting feedback, and communicating to developers and stakeholders throughout the projects life cycles.
- Experience in UX research and user-testing, from surveys to in-person interviews. You should drive and justify your design decisions using the resulting of these learnings, along with data and design principles.
- An online portfolio that can demonstrate your visual design skills and your expertise in designing intuitive, delightful and efficient user interfaces, across web and mobile.
- Comfortable working autonomously, with a strong sense of ownership as part of a small team. All of your work will have a substantial impact on the growth of the business, as you’ll have direct input into our decision making.
- Confident using Adobe CC Suite, Sketch, and prototyping tools of your choice.
- Experience thriving in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity. You are confident of taking on challenges that you've not tried before.
- Have cross-platform design experiences (Web, android, iOS, emails).
- Fluent in English with excellent communication skills, happy to present your own thinking, ideas and design work at meetings with stakeholders and founders.

Bonus:
- Experience of HTML and CSS.
- Experience of Agile / Scrum, or similar.
- Have managed other designers / taken point on project.
- Have shipped products, even personal projects.
- Experience with design systems and style guides.
- Experience working in startups
- Experience working on design within an entertainment or tech company.
- Experience managing junior team members.
- This role is primarily aimed at a london based, experienced UX/UI designer. If you feel you would be a great culture fit and are remote and/or mid-level in your career, please still get in touch. We’d love to hear from you!

WHY US?
Have a real impact on the company's product and growth.
Work with passionate people across the world, who love music as much as you do.
Free gigs with amazing lineups + Discounts for cinema tickets at the RichMix cinema.

LOCATION
London. Rich Mix building in Bethnal Green Road, Shoreditch, east London. Bright, modern office, with a shared fully-kitted kitchen space. The venue has a cinema and rooms with art events. It is next to Shoreditch High Street station and the Boxpark pop-up mall (food and shops).

SALARY
£Competitive... dependent on relevant experience and cross-disciplinary skills.

HOW TO APPLY
Email jobs@sofarsounds.com, addressed to Allie.

APPLICATION SHOULD INCLUDE:
- Personal website, CV, your profile on LinkedIn.
- An online portfolio with examples of previous work. Your designs should include explanations of your process where possible.
- Anything else you think we’d like to hear about (ie. side projects, other interests)

items.content:
DESCRIPTION

About us

At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody. Our fast growing team is located in London, United Kingdom and Tallinn, Estonia, and we know that what we’re building is bigger than anything on the market today. Join us!

The role

We’re a small design team who work very closely with each other and our development teams. This allows each of us to have a big impact on shaping the future of the Monese product, both functionally and visually.

Our process and skill requirements are wide ranging as we work as full stack product designers across the UX/UI of both our IOS and Android apps. We cover all aspects of the design process, from participating in Design sprints and wire-framing features, through to high fidelity UI design with illustrations and animations. We regularly prototype and test features with real users. We also help conducting layout adjustments for internal tools (i.e BackOffice). Finally we write feature design specs and provide detailed style guides for developers.

We’re looking for a mid-weight level Product Designer, someone who’s driven by problem solving and designing great experiences, whilst being obsessive over visual craft and beauty. If you’re looking to take your next step and produce the best work of your career, we’re very excited to work with you.

REQUIREMENTS
Strong UI/UX skills
Strong mobile app and responsive web design experience
An expert using Sketch and the Adobe Creative Suite
Illustration and iconography as well as motion design and animation skills
Experience with prototyping tools
Experience working directly with developers on design implementation
Driven, hardworking and comfortable in a fast-paced environment
The ability to take charge of your time and meet deadlines
The ability to think at a high level about product strategy and vision (not just 'how it should look' but 'what we should build and why')
Familiarity using Jira would also be a plus

BENEFITS

Benefits of working at Monese:

Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks
Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities
Flexible working schedule and possibility to work remotely
Stock options and competitive salary

Sounds like something for you?

Please send us your CV and cover letter as well as a few samples of your work.

We will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately, so be quick to apply!
